channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Holiday spending rose 3.8%, with apparel and restaurants strong, Mastercard says
item.description: Holiday spending rose 3.8% from a year ago, topping last year’s growth, as consumers were “willing and able” to spend, if there was a good deal, Maste...

item.title: Gold Flat; Further Signals Awaited
item.description: Gold was flat in early Asian trade. The precious metal continues to trade in a rangebound manner in thinned holiday trade, Angel One said.

item.title: Most bullish Apple analyst gets a little more bullish on AI-enhanced iPhones
item.description: Wedbush’s Daniel Ives further boosts price target for Apple on expected holiday iPhone surge

item.title: Why 2025 looks like a great year to retire
item.description: The baby-boom generation has landed on its feet — again.

item.title: Putin follows Trump’s bitcoin embrace. Can crypto help Russia evade sanctions?
item.description: The Russian government has been a historic opponent of bitcoin, banning its use for domestic payments, but has recently come to see the potential bene...

item.title: Ringgit Could Remain Under Pressure in 1Q
item.description: The Malaysian ringgit could remain under pressure in 1Q, amid inflation concerns in the U.S., which may drive monetary policy uncertainty and keep the...

item.title: FTSE 100 Expected to Open Lower in Thin Holiday Trade
item.description: The FTSE 100 is expected to open a few points lower following a mixed session on Wall Street, as bad news on the U.S. jobs front did little to boost F...

item.title: Biden’s gift to Trump: Golden opportunity to supercharge the economy
item.description: Dismantling Biden’s industrial policies would greatly harm U.S. economic growth.

item.title: Oil Ticks Lower as Market Awaits Fresh Cues
item.description: Oil prices edged lower in early Asian trading as the market awaited fresh cues.

item.title: The Celebrity Activist Investor Is Going Extinct
item.description: As it turns out, you don’t need a tough activist reputation to spur change at companies anymore.
